segments.source_content: I'm quite excited by the upcoming TypeScript 5.8 `erasableSyntaxOnly` flag that forbids usage of features such as enums. This is the path toward making your app compatible Node.js built-in support, and maybe browsers too in the future.

C'est la voie vers la compatibilitÃ© de votre application avec le support natif de Node.js, et peut-Ãªtre aussi des navigateurs Ã  l'avenir.

C'est la voie vers la compatibilitÃ© de votre application avec le support natif de Node.js, et peut-Ãªtre aussi des navigateurs Ã  l'avenir.

- ğŸ“œ [Next.js: an honest review](https://beeps.dev/blog/nextjs-an-honest-review): An interesting and quite pragmatic list of pros/cons of using Next.js in production apps.
- ğŸ“œ [Why I Wonâ€™t Use JSDOM](https://www.epicweb.dev/why-i-won-t-use-jsdom): Recommends testing frontend components in an actual browser, using Vitest Browser Mode and Playwright, instead of a polyfilled Node.js env like JSDOM. The React integration is similar to using React Testing Library.
- ğŸ“œ [UX++ and DX++ with Sync Engines](https://www.carlassmann.com/blog/improve-ux-dx-with-sync-engines): Explains why itâ€™s difficult to invalidate queries and implement optimistic UI with React Query, then propose to use a local-first model with Replicache.
- ğŸ“œ [Moving on from React, a Year Later](https://kellysutton.com/2025/01/18/moving-on-from-react-a-year-later.html): Feedback on removing React from a server-rendered Rails application, considering JS a handicap.

translations.en: **[Repensez l'UX de vos applications React avec Reactile](https://www.reactile.net/?utm_source=ThisweekinReact)**

segments.source_content: Reactile is an UI/UX turnkey framework which features an out-of-the-box, intuitive tiling display with workspaces. It encourages parallel workloads for large web solutions within a single browser tab. Implement your own view containers, widgets and logic using React and let Reactile handle the display for you.

ImplÃ©mentez vos propres conteneurs de vue, widgets et logique en utilisant React et laissez Reactile gÃ©rer l'affichage pour vous.
